result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R Leverton-Duerst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathan R Leverton-Duerst is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathan R Leverton-Duerst was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Transfer of probation authorized to Green co.

miscConds.notes: Remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any co defn.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 if completes probation w/out any new charges or ATRs.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

SIGNATURE BOND SET- REFERRAL TO BMP
- The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM in person by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail and abide by all rules set by BMP. If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500 (per case). BMP is removed as condition of bond.
